definition: to work hard/to look after
to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
variant of 肏[cao4]
old variant of 操[cao1]
to toil/labor/laborer/to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/meritorious deed/to console (Taiwan pr. [lao4] for this sense)

sentences.english: He began to work day and night for the construction of the capital of New China.
sentences.chinese: 他开始为新中国首都的建设日夜操劳。

sentences.english: Stay away from work till next Tuesday, and don't overdo things.
sentences.chinese: 好好休息，直到下周二前都不要工作，不要操劳过度。

sentences.english: Her illness was induced by overwork.
sentences.chinese: 她的病是操劳过度引起的。

sentences.english: Like rustiness, idleness consume more body energies than work.
sentences.chinese: 懒惰像生锈一样，比操劳更能消耗身体。

sentences.english: His body broke down because of overwork.
sentences.chinese: 因操劳过度他滴身体垮下来了。

sentences.english: The manager was distressed by excessive work.
sentences.chinese: 经理因过度操劳而精疲力竭。

sentences.english: It’s important to consciously recognize these days and maybe take a break from writing so as to avoid over-working yourself.
sentences.chinese: 有意识地休息一下以免过度操劳就很重要了。

sentences.english: He burns his candle at both ends.
sentences.chinese: 他操劳过度，如蜡烛双头烧。

sentences.english: Mom is in her mid-seventies, and those hands I once thought to be so rough are still doing things for me and my family.
sentences.chinese: 那双我认为很粗糙的手依然为我和我的家庭操劳着。

sentences.english: My brother and I worked day and night to keep the family.
sentences.chinese: 我和我兄弟为了养家糊口而日夜操劳。

sentences.english: Mother has busied herself with my affairs for too long.
sentences.chinese: 母亲为我的事操劳得太久了。

sentences.english: Her mother died of diffcult labor.
Doth God exact day-labor, light denied?
sentences.chinese: 神苛求白天操劳，光明却不给？

sentences.english: It might be prudent not to overwork those good angels .
sentences.chinese: 不过还是谨慎点儿，别让这些善良的天使操劳过度。

sentences.english: That overexertion should be avoided is certain.
sentences.chinese: 应避免过度操劳，这是肯定的。

definition: to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
tired/exhausted/worn out/to toil
to work hard/to toil
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to toil/hard work
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
laborious
to worry about
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
to manage/to handle
exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)
to accumulate work causes sickness (idiom); to fall ill from constant overwork
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
to worry/to be on one's mind
to be busy rushing about/to bustle about
busy/bustling
